meanings.definition: A person who is chronically unlucky or prone to mishaps.
meanings.sent1: Poor shlimazels always seem to have bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The group of shlimazels encountered one mishap after another.
meanings.sent3: The shlimazels' bad luck was so consistent, it almost seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: The shlimazels' misfortunes piled up like a tower of cards.
meanings.sent5: The image of the shlimazels' misfortunes was etched in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: Plural form of shlimazel, referring to multiple unlucky individuals.
meanings.sent1: We felt sorry for the poor shlimazels who couldn't catch a break.
meanings.sent2: The town was filled with shlimazels who shared their tales of woe.
meanings.sent3: The shlimazels' misfortunes seemed to multiply when they gathered together.
meanings.sent4: The streets were bustling with shlimazels, each carrying their own cloud of bad luck.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the shlimazels huddled together was a poignant reminder of life's unpredictability.
